abstract: The automaker is not expected to admit wrongdoing in paying the fine for concealing information about a recall.
snippet: The automaker is not expected to admit wrongdoing in paying the fine for concealing information about a recall.
lead_paragraph: Toyota is expected to tell the Transportation Department on Monday that it will pay a $16.4 million fine, the largest government penalty ever against an automaker, for concealing information related to its sticking pedal recall.

headline.main: Toyota Is Expected to Pay $16.4 Million Fine
headline.print_headline: Toyota Is Expected to Pay $16.4 Million Fine Sought by U.S. Over Recall of Sticking Pedals

byline.original: By Nick Bunkley and Micheline Maynard

abstract: A recall of the 2010 Lexus GX 460 will address a problem with the way the vehicle handles on curves.
snippet: A recall of the 2010 Lexus GX 460 will address a problem with the way the vehicle handles on curves.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Toyota on Monday added another model to its long list of recalls, hours after agreeing to pay the largest fine ever imposed by the government against an automaker.

headline.print_headline: Toyota To Recall A Model Of Lexus
